actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-571, by Mr. Frost.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5373. Waiving certain points of order against various provisions of the bill and amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution. The amendment specified in the report to be offered by Representative Brown or his designee shall be debatable for 30 minutes equally divided and controlled by the proponent and an opponent and shall not be subject to amendment. No other amendment to the paragraph under the heading "General Science and Research Activities" shall be in order until the amendment specified in the report to be offered by Mr. Brown of California or his designee has been disposed of.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 146.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 377 - 44 (Roll no. 195).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 5373) making appropriations for energy and water development for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1993, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 5373 (appropriations for energy and water development).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 5373) making appropriations for energy and water development for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1993, and for other purposes.
